description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Avignon" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Avignon

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Avignon, Avenio is a chic dining destination that effortlessly combines modern elegance with a relaxed ambiance. Run by a passionate young couple with experience in high-end culinary establishments, this restaurant prides itself on using carefully sourced local ingredients to create inventive dishes that reflect contemporary tastes. Guests can indulge in delightful offerings such as truffle risotto and herb-crusted baked cod, all while enjoying the inviting atmosphere enhanced by a seasonal terrace.

sources.snippet: Another resplendent option for lunch or dinner, and a favorite of Gaudin's, Avenio treats patrons to delectable plates like a goat cheese tart with smoked duck breast and an herb-crusted baked cod that channels the legacy of Proven√ßal cuisine while bringing something new to the table. The setting is chic and modern yet relaxed. Not surprisingly, the tables book up fast.
sources.shortName: Avignon, France Travel Guide

places.name: Avenio

reviews.text: Excellent service.  Did not feel rushed.  Lovely wine selection.  The food was prepared with devotion,  and a master of the culinary craft.   I am celiaque,  and the staff was knowledgeable and accommodated via modification where needed.   The complexity and creativity in our meals was very appreciated.   Merci!

What a find!  Very hospitable staff.  Top notch food at reasonable prices.  Wonderful wines by the glass.

cucumber and feta gazpacho

Dish that I cannot recall, but seriously looks awesome right? Arugula and tomato and something. Sorry can't recall.

Iberian pork with passion fruit was a treat!  So soft, so tasty.  Could take bites and sip wine all day.

The bread was amazing - get it!

Just a wonderful experience.  Wish I could describe the dishes better or more precisely.  I remember saying that this was an excellent meal and at the price we felt like we robbed the place.

*** Highlights:
‚ÄúThe cutest restaurant ever‚Äù - my wife

*** What we liked:
The Magret de Canard and the Fish are absolutely sensational - how do they make these dishes so well executed? The apricot tart is homemade

*** Recommended?
It's a very nice spot located center of Avignon. They offer several menus varying between 27-45‚Ç¨. The service is very polite, the food is impressive and the presentation is spot on. Will return and recommend

places.address: 135 Av. Pierre Semard b√¢timent H1, 84000 Avignon, France

places.generalDescription: The Palais des Papes, once a rival to the Vatican, is an imposing structure consisting of two different parts: the severe Palais Vieux and the more decorative Palais Nouveau. The interiors are austere due to the loss of original furnishings during history, but visitors can still imagine its medieval splendor with colorful frescoes and grand halls. The palace hosts cultural events in its beautiful courtyard, showcasing performances in various languages.

sources.snippet: At the same time religious, or, at the bend of a place, stands most of the time a church, a collegiate church or the prestigious and famous: Palais des Papes. In the city center near the Rh√¥ne on the authors of the so-called Rocher des Doms, this majestic Gothic building floods the city with its aura full of ancient religious and cultural splendor. The notoriety of Avignon as seat of the papacy in the Middle Ages has endured today, and the latter is still as attractive and dynamic in the field of the Arts.
sources.shortName: Hotel Bed & Breakfast Avignon 84 City Center

sources.snippet: The Palais des Papes in Avignon is a historic building built in the 14th century. This building was used as a Papal Palace and is one of the most important historic buildings in Avignon. With its historic architecture and enchanting atmosphere, the Palais des Papes is an ideal place for a romantic trip.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Places in Avignon

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre visiting during the height of summer, the train is a great way to escape the heat and see the sights of the city in a short time. Tours are available in 10 different languages, including special commentary designed for kids, and depart from the Palais des Papes.
sources.shortName: 15 BEST Things To Do In Avignon [July 2024]

sources.snippet: The Palais des Papes is one of Avignon‚Äôs most famous landmarks. This massive Gothic palace was the home of the popes during the Avignon Papacy in the 14th century. Today, it‚Äôs a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of France‚Äôs most popular tourist attractions.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do in Avignon, France (2025)

sources.snippet: No trip to Avignon would be complete without visiting the majestic Pope‚Äôs Palace. The largest gothic palace in the world, the Palais des Papes dominates the Avignon cityscape and draws all eyes to its grand towers and angular battlements.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Things to do in Avignon, France

sources.snippet: The Place du Palais des Papes, with its terraces of caf√©s and restaurants, is the perfect place to enjoy a golden-hour view of the monumental fa√ßade of the Palais des Papes, the H√¥tel de la Monnaie and the Cath√©drale des Doms.
sources.shortName: Palais des Papes, Pont d‚ÄôAvignon, lavender fields‚Ä¶ The top 10 ‚ÄúInstagrammable‚Äù spots in Avignon

sources.snippet: Stroll through medieval alleyways, savour gourmet dining, enjoy a secret visit to the Palais des Papes... Avignon is the ideal destination for couples. Discover my favourite places to spend the weekend.
sources.shortName: A romantic weekend in Avignon
23 Captivating Things to Do in Avignon: Insider's Guide

places.name: Palais des Papes

reviews.text:
Beautiful interesting place full of history! Definitely it is worth visiting and exploring! And the garden! A perfect oasis!üíö

Unfortunately, some parts were closed due to a fashion show which happened prior to my visit.

This was an amazing self- guided tour using a tablet. Very interesting history. Beautiful views from the top. Lots of stairs, so be prepared for that. It was warm and muggy inside. Some of the inside has not been restored. Which made it that much more interesting. Give yourself 1-2hours.
There's zero reasons to go inside. Its the most plain palace I've seen in my life. There's absolutely nothing to see during the tour. The palace looks much better from the outside which is free.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Fou de Fafa is a cozy and popular dining spot in Avignon, run by a British couple who are passionate about providing delicious meals. The restaurant offers an intimate and picturesque setting with a relaxed atmosphere. The menu features simple yet exquisite dishes, from sumptuous vegetable carpaccio to perfectly seared duck breast, all beautifully presented. The carefully selected wine list complements the delightful cuisine.

sources.snippet: Looking for something a bit more laid-back that‚Äôs still guaranteed to be memorable and downright delicious?. Fou de Fafa never disappoints. It‚Äôs casual and inviting, with homespun charm, elegant dishes, and a lovely terrace for an alfresco dinner.
sources.shortName: Avignon, France Travel Guide

places.name: Restaurant Fou de Fafa

reviews.text: The best dining experience we received on our month-long European honeymoon! The owners (husband & wife team) make you feel so special and welcome. I made the reservation a month before our visit and the owner welcomed me with open arms and congratulated my husband and I on our marriage. Her energy is unmatched. Her husband's cooking‚Ä¶ I don't even know where to begin but it was the best meal we have ever had. I truly hope we will get to come back in the future! Thank you for an unforgettable evening!

Absolutely fantastic experience and evening!

A special thank you to the wonderful woman who created such a warm and welcoming atmosphere - it was truly in the air.

She was incredibly attentive, gave great recommendations, and made the whole experience even betterüåü

The food was perfect - everything was absolutely delicious. It's one of the reasons I would come back to Avignon again‚ù§Ô∏è‚ú®

The food here is fantastic. Fresh and homemade. The gazpacho is so complex and refreshing, a perfect blend of fresh high-quality ingredients. The duck main course is superb-one of the best duck dishes I've ever had. The beef carpaccio with honey sauce is creative; the sweetness of the honey somehow works perfectly well with the thinly sliced high-quality beef, paired with fresh carrots and bell peppers for a crunchy herbal garnish.
The hostess is an elegant British woman, whose French husband is the highly skilled chef behind the scene. The husband-wife team clearly poured a lot of love into the food they serve at this cozy homey restaurant. The atmosphere is very intimate. The restaurant is small so I highly recommend you book ahead of time. During the theater festival they're often times booked out many days in advance, but if you're lucky enough you might get a table because someone else canceled last minute. Anyway, I highly recommend booking in advance!

places.address: 17 Rue Des Trois Faucons, 84000 Avignon, France

places.generalDescription: Hotel De L'Atelier is a charming accommodation set in a converted 16th-century factory, offering a refined stay with a courtyard patio and an inviting dining room. Located in the historical district of Villeneuve-les-Avignon, this family-friendly hotel provides easy access to popular attractions such as Palais des Papes and Eglise Collegiale Notre-Dame. The former silk factory features thick stone walls surrounding lush gardens and private courtyards, providing a tranquil retreat.

sources.snippet: Occupying a former silk factory that dates back to the 16th century, the Hotel De L‚ÄôAtelier is a hidden refuge in the fortressed village of Villeneuve‚ÄëLez‚ÄëAvignon. It lies just across the Rh√¥ne River from Avignon, with thick stone walls encircling a lush garden and private courtyards basked in sunshine. Tastefully decorated rooms boast en-suites with earthy French toiletries and indulgent baths, as well as private terraces in some.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Stay in Avignon, France

places.name: Hotel De L'Atelier

reviews.text:
Lovely hotel! With garden and terrace !!!
The breakfast is complete with orange press juice, cappuccino and everything you want from a continental breakfast.
For work or leisure, this hotel has it all! I came for business and had such a pleasant sleep (no noise) + you can walk to the church and touristy places.
You have plenty restaurant options around the hotel, an ATM just one block away, at least 2 bakeries.
Thursday, a local market is open 1 block away next to ‚Äúbank Agricole‚Äù. Honey and cheese over there is just great!

The rooms were super awesome. Antique terracotta tile, stone walls, and that vintage French vibe, while still having modern amenities. Pretty big rooms for a French hotel also. The service was pretty great. It was sometimes hard to find someone to help you, but whenever they were helping you they were amazing. Location was great. It was close to a lot of French places to eat, villeneuve castle, and a short ride away from avignon centre. Perfect for touring without the crowds near where you stay.

Nice hotel but away from Avignon old town. Could be good or bad aspect, depending on needs. Old building, with crooked stairway, but clean and quiet. Breakfast was good, nothing warm except eggs if one is willing to boil them. Freshly squeezed orange juice was perfect. 1.4 euro bus stop to Avignon old town not too far.

places.address: 5 Rue de la Foire, 30400 Villeneuve-l√®s-Avignon, France

places.generalDescription: Auberge de Cassagne & Spa is a luxurious five-star hotel located just outside Avignon, in the commune of Le Pontet. Set in an 1850 farmstead, this classic French country house offers charming and spacious rooms and suites adorned with floral prints and pastel shades. The hotel features a fine-dining restaurant helmed by Chef Philippe Boucher, serving gourmet Provencal cuisine alongside an impressive selection of wines.

sources.snippet: For a refuge that‚Äôs just a short drive outside the city center, set your sights on Auberge de Cassagne & Spa. ‚ÄúA gorgeous Proven√ßal house-turned-hotel with 35 impeccably decorated rooms, excellent spa facilities, a superb fine-dining restaurant, and beautiful gardens, it really feels like a luxury countryside retreat and is always a winner with our most discerning clients,‚Äù says Graham Carter, co-founder of Unforgettable Travel Company and leading France specialist.
sources.shortName: Avignon, France Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Nestled amidst peaceful gardens on the outskirts of Avignon, the Auberge de Cassagne & Spa is a classic French country house that exudes charm and luxury. Floral prints and pastel shades feature in the spacious rooms and suites, creating a homely ambience while boasting all the modern amenities you‚Äôd expect of a five-star hotel. Chef Philippe Boucher is the creative mind behind the hotel‚Äôs renowned restaurant where gourmet Proven√ßal cuisine is showcased, accompanied by an outstanding choice of wines and the region‚Äôs best vintages.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Stay in Avignon, France

sources.snippet: Elegant rooms feature floral prints, soft colours and all the mod cons. An outdoor pool, fragrant gardens, and an extensive spa. Outstanding gourmet cuisine and a lovely bar area.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Avignon, France (2025)

places.name: Auberge de Cassagne & Spa | Hotel 5 √©toiles Avignon

reviews.text: We stayed at this beautiful property for two nights. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Spa facility was nice, open till 1 am each day. I was able to enjoy the indoor pool and hot tube at 10 PM with my teenage son after a day at Avignon. Hotel room was very nice with high ceiling and very effective air conditioner. I even got a beautiful rose in my room! Hotel breakfast was very good too with high quality local food and a fresh orange juice machine. I would recommend this place.

I'm really shocked at how this hotel has a 4.6 review and maybe I completely missed something but I feel like I'm being quite generous with a 1 star rating. The rooms are a bit old and tired and nothing in them screams ‚Äú5 star‚Äù. We were fresh off a stay at another SLH hotel location in Barcelona which was fantastic and truly a 5 star experience with friendly and helpful staff and great rooms. This location is like a ‚Ç¨100 hotels.com pick. The ‚Äúcomplimentary water‚Äù was a cheap plastic bottle and the in room coffee wouldn't even be fitting for a Best Western. At breakfast, we had a juice spill on the table. Not one staff member offered to help, or even a napkin. They're completely disengaged. Additionally, the location isn't convenient to anything and the outside of the building, and neighborhood, were not exactly impressive. The cherry on top was them trying to charge me for an extra breakfast for my 2 year old who ate a croissant. This property is not deserving to be within the SLH property group with Hilton and is a poor representation of the Hilton brand.

This hotel was a pleasant experience. It is definitely not worth the price that we paid but it was not a bad hotel. The rooms were very nice, standard size for what I would expect in Europe. The shower and bath were nice and we used both. It was cold so we didn't use the outdoor pool, but the indoor pool, hot tub and spa were nice. Breakfast was a disappointment after our stay at a different SLH location in Narbonne but was acceptable.
The negatives are room layout vs office location and how to get to the breakfast area. We initially kind of got lost trying to find the breakfast area the first day. The paths are not flat, they are natural rock paths which made rolling luggage difficult. Only one restaurant and it's very expensive. The location itself is fine and felt safe, but it is not a hotel to book if you want to Uber from the airport and plan to walk everywhere. We read this on other reviews and we had a rental car because our main plan was visiting tasting rooms in Gigondas and Chateauneuf de Pape so it didn't cause us any issues.

places.address: AVIGNON, 450 All. de Cassagne, 84130 Le Pontet, France

places.generalDescription: Jardin des Doms is a picturesque public garden located on a hill in Avignon, offering stunning views of the Rhone River and the countryside. The park features a pond, a cafe, tall trees, fountains, and sculptures, making it an ideal place for leisurely strolls while enjoying the panoramic scenery. Visitors can access the garden for free during its opening hours from 7:30 AM to 8 PM.

sources.snippet: ¬©The Un verre aux jardins event in the gardens of the Palais des Papes with a DJ from the R√©sonnance festival - Photo credit: Olivier Tresson / Avignon Tourisme|Olivier Tresson / Avignon Tourisme
sources.shortName: Palais des Papes, Pont d‚ÄôAvignon, lavender fields‚Ä¶ The top 10 ‚ÄúInstagrammable‚Äù spots in Avignon

sources.snippet: This garden is located at the foot of Rocher des Doms and is famous for its magnificent views. Jardin des Doms is an ideal place for a romantic picnic.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Places in Avignon

places.name: Jardin des Doms

reviews.text:
Rocher des Doms - beautiful, but absolutely freezing in jan
Even just looking at this photo brings back the chill of that day ü•∂ I always imagined Provence as mild and sun-kissed, but Avignon in January? Brutal.

From the viewpoint of Rocher des Doms, I got a view of the Rh√¥ne River gently cradling the city - and the iconic broken span of Pont Saint-B√©n√©zet stretching across it. It was stunning‚Ä¶ but way too cold to even think about walking over to that bridge.

A bit difficult to find the entry point. You have to exit the walled part of the city on the north side and find the stairs leading up to the garden and lookout. Currently not wheelchair accessible. Hardly anyone there.  It would be a peaceful spot to have a picnic or read a book overlooking the Rh√¥ne. Currently some parts are fenced off, and the area looks a bit rundown. There is a great semicircular tiled map indicating important landmarks visible on the horizon and in the environs. However some of the trees have grown so tall you can't see the landmarks!

Jardin des Doms is a true gem in Avignon, offering a serene and picturesque escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Perched on a hill, this beautiful garden provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Rh√¥ne River, the iconic Pont d'Avignon, and the surrounding landscapes.

The garden itself is meticulously maintained, with well-tended lawns, colorful flowerbeds, and charming shaded pathways. It's the perfect place to take a leisurely stroll, relax on a bench, or simply enjoy the peaceful atmosphere. The layout is both elegant and inviting, making it a wonderful spot for a quiet moment of reflection or a leisurely picnic.

One of the standout features of Jardin des Doms is the stunning views it offers. From the garden, you can capture some of the best photo opportunities in Avignon, with the city's historic landmarks beautifully framed against the backdrop of lush greenery.

The garden is also home to several statues and fountains, adding to its charm and providing interesting focal points throughout your visit. It's clear that a lot of care and effort goes into preserving the garden's beauty and ensuring that visitors have a memorable experience.

places.generalDescription: Avignon Cathedral, also known as Cathedrale Notre-Dame des Doms d'Avignon, is a 12th-century Romanesque-style building located next to the Papal Palace. The cathedral is adorned with a gilded statue of the Virgin Mary and is a UNESCO Heritage Site. Its elevated position on a rocky ledge allows it to be visible from various points in the city and beyond.

sources.snippet: Though it may sit somewhat in the shadow of nearby Palais des Papes, the beautiful 12th-century Cath√©drale Notre-Dame-des-Doms is well worth a visit. The interior of this cathedral is one of the highlights of a visit here, dominated by old frescoes and marble statues. Another of the structure‚Äôs famous features is the golden statue of the Virgin Mary which stands atop the cathedral, peering out across Avignon ‚Äì it‚Äôs a great place for a photo opp!
sources.shortName: Falling in love with Avignon and 10 unmissable things to do

sources.snippet: The Avignon Cathedral is located in the historic center of Avignon. This gothic cathedral was built in the 14th century and is one of the city‚Äôs most iconic landmarks. In the past, the cathedral was the seat of the Avignon Papacy.
sources.shortName: Best Things To Do in Avignon, France (2025)

sources.snippet: Avignon Cathedral is a historic building located in the city. This cathedral was built in the 12th century and is famous for its historic architecture. Avignon Cathedral is an ideal place for a romantic trip.
sources.shortName: The Best Romantic Places in Avignon

sources.snippet: One of the most impressive structures is the Basilica of Notre Dame des Doms, located near the Palace of the Popes. It was built in the 1100s and underwent renovations in the 15th and 17th centuries.
sources.shortName: 23 Captivating Things to Do in Avignon: Insider's Guide

sources.snippet: Whether you visit the city during the height of summer, or in the freeze of winter, here are some of the best things to do in Avignon:
sources.shortName: 15 BEST Things To Do In Avignon [July 2024]
The Project Gutenberg eBook of Romantic Cities of Provence, by Mona Caird

places.name: Notre Dame des Doms

reviews.text: Beautiful cathedral inside and out. It was an especially calming place for us. We've also been there in the evening when the nuns were saying their prayers and it was beautiful. Very special cathedral, a must visit if you are in the area.

Huge church!!!
So beautiful, filled with little details.
If you want to donate some money, is very easy. Just need to tap the card and choose the amount.
When we went, there was someone playing the organ, so beautiful

This is Avignon's principal Romanesque cathedral, originally constructed around 1150. When the Papacy relocated to Avignon in the 14th century, the cathedral became the site of major papal liturgical ceremonies and masses. Its proximity to the Palais des Papes elevated its religious and symbolic status significantly. The building has undergone several restorations, especially in the late 19th century, which preserved its original Romanesque structure while incorporating Gothic and Baroque elements. One of its most striking features is the gilded statue of the Virgin Mary atop the western fa√ßade, visible from many parts of the city. Inside, the cathedral houses the marble tomb of Pope John XXII, making it not only a religious but also a historical monument closely tied to Avignon's unique role in Church history.

places.generalDescription: La Divine Com√©die is an upscale boutique bed and breakfast located in Avignon, France. It offers a storied mansion with genteel suites, an outdoor pool, a spa, and views of the Palais des Papes. The property boasts the largest private garden in Avignon with mature trees and lush palms, providing a tranquil setting for guests to relax.

sources.snippet: My go-to suggestion for travelers who want a boutique stay that‚Äôs right in the heart of Avignon, La Divine Com√©die took nearly seven years to rebuild,‚Äù says Carter. ‚ÄúGilles, a stylist from Paris, and his partner, Amaury, converted a derelict building into a beautiful five-key, homestay-style property.‚Äù Each bedroom is individually styled and full of character with dozens of hand-picked art pieces and decorative accents.
sources.shortName: Avignon, France Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Adorned with artworks and antiques from the 17th ‚Äì 20th centuries, La Divine Com√©die is a hidden retreat in Avignon‚Äôs historic heart. It nestles in a peaceful garden with koi-filled ponds and a glass-walled orangery, not to mention enviable views of the Popes‚Äô Palace. As you step inside, there‚Äôs something to attract the eye around every corner in the Gilles Jauffret-designed interior, including an elegant lounge and well-stocked library dedicated to art and design.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Stay in Avignon, France

sources.snippet: A restored ancient mansion boasting the largest private garden in Avignon, right in the historic centre. Elegant suites are decorated with a choice selection of artworks and antiques but the hues are a cool steely grey and bathrooms modern. Boasting a pool and a mini-spa.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Avignon, France (2025)

sources.snippet: La Divine Com√©die is located in the historic centre of Avignon, close to Le Palais des Papes. It offers 5 spacious and unique suites all overlooking the garden. The property has the largest private garden in Avignon, as well as a swimming stream, spa and outdoor jacuzzi.
sources.shortName: Romantic weekends and stays in Provence

places.name: La Divine Com√©die

reviews.text: Stay in a palace/bed&breakfast, in a large and secluded garden in the center of Avignon. Within walking distance of all attractions, restaurants, and shops, the house boasts five elegant suites, each individually designed. A delicious and generous breakfast is served in the garden dining room in winter, and outdoors, poolside in summer. The staff is attentive but unobtrusive.

Eclectic aesthetics! I love how secluded you could feel staying here yet 5 min walk away you can already reach the busy streets and the Pape's palace. Service is good, room is clean, and I love the garden area and the beautiful landscape. If you expect the service that of a five star big hotel, it's not here. But if you appreciate the 5-room only privacy and a good service that's not intrusive, you'll find it here

We stayed 2 nights in Nov, although it was off season, the hotel was beautiful, the staff were very friendly. The French decoration in the rooms and all around the hotel was impressive, The breakfast was also great.

places.address: 16 Imp. Jean Pierre Gras, 84000 Avignon, France

places.generalDescription: La Fourchette is a charming and cozy bistro located just a few minutes from the Palais des Papes in Avignon. Since 1982, this restaurant has been an institution in the city, offering creative twists on classic French dishes and bistro favorites.

sources.snippet: La Fourchette is an elegant neighborhood bistro serving traditional recipes like smoked haddock salad, curry fried oysters, and ratatouille made with seasonal ingredients. Photographs, books, and wood inject the space with heaps of warmth and personality.
sources.shortName: Avignon, France Travel Guide

places.name: La Fourchette

reviews.text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
La Fourchette was a wonderful dining experience. Every plate showcased fresh, local ingredients prepared with care, and you could taste the quality in every bite. Nestled in a charming spot, the restaurant has an inviting, intimate atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. The service was attentive without being overbearing, and the food was among the best we enjoyed in Paris. A place we'd gladly return to!

Very nice restaurant. Service was warm and welcoming. Asparagus salad and escargot both excellent. However, The main gambas dish was underwhelming and should only be an appetizer. I asked the waiter if he would recommend and said it was great, they always say that. Wish he would have taken the time to assist and describe more. The pork main was very good and the deserts were incredible.

recomend by our host. the dinner went well. we started with cheakpeas salad with the notes of sisho, which becoming fusion like japanese style. the escargot was nice. main onglet (hanging tender) beef steak was fantastic. the white chateauneuf du pape üëç. the selection of wines is vast.

places.generalDescription: Mas de Capelou is a charming guesthouse located in a beautifully restored 17th-century Provencal farmhouse just outside of Avignon. This tranquil retreat offers B&B accommodation and features a seasonal outdoor pool, terrace, and gardens for guests to enjoy. Each guest room is uniquely decorated and equipped with a private bathroom. The peaceful setting on the island of Barthelasse provides an escape from the city while still being conveniently connected to Avignon's cultural attractions and restaurants.

sources.snippet: Set within a beautifully restored 17th-century Proven√ßal farmhouse, the Mas de Capelou is a tranquil retreat for both couples and families. It‚Äôs situated on the peaceful island of Barthelasse, which is directly connected by bridge to the medieval heart of Avignon. Five minutes‚Äô drive will see you exploring the cultural attractions and restaurants for which this city is renowned, with the peace and serenity of Mas de Capelou awaiting at the end of the day.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Stay in Avignon, France

sources.snippet: Just 7km from Avignon centre, Le Mas de Capelou offers five rooms and suites plus four apartments which sleep from 2 to 6. A period exterior makes way to modern, chic interiors. There's a large outdoor swimming pool and many peaceful outdoor seating areas.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Avignon, France (2025)

places.name: Mas de Capelou

reviews.text:
I don't often write reviews and would like to share this because so very good.

Valerie has created a paradise of tranquility, style and cleanliness with a beautiful garden, pool and restaurant on site; and close to Avignon.

I recommend very highly.

The rooms are nice and clean. The breakfast is Proven√ßal and the restaurant is well-run with tapas in an African setting. A lovely pool and many hidden ‚Äòcaves' makes the nice garden with fruit trees and beautiful flowers complete.  Thanks for a very nice week at this estate near Avignon ü§ó

Just a stone throw away from Avignon city centre, this BEAUTIFUL Mas is nestled in a lush greenery. We stayed in the Suite and it was very clean. All the amenities were provided. The croissant at breakfast was to die for. Highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: Hi√©ly Lucullus, located on the main shopping street in Avignon, offers a unique culinary experience created by Chef Gerald Azoulay. The restaurant features a fusion of Peruvian and Provencal cuisines known as "Perouvence," influenced by the chef's wife's heritage. The interior is decorated in Belle Epoque style, providing an elegant ambiance for diners.

sources.snippet: One of the best restaurants in Avignon, Hi√©ly Lucullus blends the cuisines of Provence and Peru in a deliciously creative way. The flavors and soul of both places come to life through tasting menus. Because it‚Äôs popular and books out so far in advance, Carter recommends securing a reservation well ahead of your trip.
sources.shortName: Avignon, France Travel Guide

places.name: Hi√©ly Lucullus

reviews.text: This is a fantastic restaurant in the heart of Avignon. It is French with a hint of Peruvian spice which works superbly as a pair. You get a 5 course set menu at lunch and a 7 course set menu at dinner which is what we had. The setting is formal and the sever was very pleasant and very knowledgeable about the food. Would highly recommend.

We had dinner on Saturday night at this restaurant and were overwhelmed by the standard of the food. It was exceptional. Each mouthful was a pure delight of flavours, textures and creativity. The chef  blends spices from Peru with local ingredients and in season products. Very cleverly done with a brilliant result - It really was amazing.  In our humble opinion we feel this restaurant deserves a Michelin Star.

Wow. We had a fabulous 7 course meal with impeccable service by the lovely Peruvian Patricia. Every course was thoughtfully prepared with outstanding flavors and presentation. Unlike other tasting menu experiences I've had in the past, Hi√®ly is perfectly portioned and paced. It's a MUST do in Avignon. Ideally, book ahead of time on the website but we were lucky enough to walk-in during low tourist season. There are only 3 or 4 tables so book far in advance if you can. Worth every euro and more.

places.address: 5 Rue de la R√©publique, 84000 Avignon, France

places.generalDescription: Tour Philippe-le-Bel is a historic fortress constructed in the 13th century by King Philip IV of France at the entrance of the Avignon Bridge. It served as a strategic stronghold in medieval southern France. Today, it stands as the only remaining vestige of the fortress and features beautiful vaulted halls hosting art exhibitions. The bridge it once guarded has been dismantled and rebuilt over time, with only four arches, a gatehouse, and a chapel remaining from its original structure.

sources.snippet: There is a vast work on Provence by le Sieur Honor√© de Bouche, Docteur en Theologie, A.P.D.S.I., printed at Aix, by Charles David, "printer to the King, the clergy and the town," MDCLXIV. It is bound in ancient brown leather;‚Äîtwo majestic volumes which have to be propped up against something substantial or laid upon a family dining-table in order to be read in any sort of security. Less serious treatment, such as an attempt to balance the tomes on the knee between the arms of a chair, however solid, always results in a temporary eclipse of the student.
sources.shortName: The Project Gutenberg eBook of Romantic Cities of Provence, by Mona Caird

places.name: Tour Philippe-le-Bel

reviews.text:
Visited at 2pm on a Thursday in mid October. Entry 4.50 euro. About 2 people there! You'll need to walk up the 124 step narrow stone spiral staircase with views out the narrow slit windows as you go. There are 3 levels - first level up there is a large room with several audiovisual booths - you can sit on a stone seat to listen in French or English. It was quite peaceful and cool there, hearing about history and construction. And one could look out the windows too.
Level 2 was another large room with what looked like some stone walls with original painted designs. I didn't spend long here. Up further to the roof, one passes through an old hinged wooden door (keep it closed to stop pigeons coming in!). The top has parapets and another round tower which is inaccessible. The views are 360¬∞ - beautiful! Of the rooftops of Villeneuve-les-Avignon, the Rh√¥ne river, Palais des Papes and Pont d'Avignon. Being mid-afternoon the light was gorgeous - reflecting off the dark grey clouds and silvery Rh√¥ne of the west. You can observe life happening below on and off the river. I think the ambience of the place was heightened by being there totally alone - and thinking of what had taken place in this area over the centuries. Well worth the climb and entry fee!!

The view from the tower top is gorgeous! Best view of Avignon! It's slightly tucked away from the city center and not touristy, so you can enjoy the view all to yourself! The price is very reasonable, for just 4 euros per person.

A definite must see for history buffs. I think this important monument is often overlooked because it's not centrally located (within close proximity to the main sites). If you're driving (or cycling) it wouldn't take you long at all to get there.

I walked from my hotel; it took me around 35 mins at a leisurely pace, with stopping time to take pictures along the way.

Interesting place to visit, and the view from the top of the tower is worth the visit alone.

places.address: Rue Mnt de la Tour, 30400 Villeneuve-l√®s-Avignon, France

sources.snippet: Tapis Rouge is another excellent wine bar, located in the heart of the historic centre of Avignon. They have a focus on Rhone varieties, and their staff is friendly and knowledgeable.
sources.shortName: 23 Captivating Things to Do in Avignon: Insider's Guide

places.name: TAPIS ROUGE

reviews.text: Great little wine bar with an owner who is a true wine connoisseur that will personally approach you and try to pair the wine with your taste profile. Plus cool music and cutest house dog french bulldog
Fantastic wine bar with a wonderful selection, good prices and delicious charcuterie boards.

This was a very nice and cozy place. The wait staff was super friendly. They had a huge selection of wine and their beer was nice and cold. They had a good selection of cheeses and meats to snack on. I would recommend this place to anyone wanting a small and cozy place with some character to relax and have a drink.

places.address: 11 Rue du Vieux Sextier, 84000 Avignon, France

sources.snippet: Another great option is Vins-7, which is not strictly a bar as you‚Äôre required to eat in order to have a drink. The owner, a former sommelier, is super knowledgeable and there is a great selection of wines, especially from the Rhone region.
sources.shortName: 23 Captivating Things to Do in Avignon: Insider's Guide

reviews.text: Good selection of wine with a friendly sommelier who has a good knowledge and passion for wine. You can ask questions on wines and he will be happily there to answer with his sincere attitude. There are some good selections of whiskeys and Rhum. Enjoy the after or evening with good company of food and alcohol.

This charming wine bar in Avignon is a true hidden gem! Whether you're a seasoned wine connoisseur or just starting your exploration, they have something for everyone. They boast a fantastic collection of wines, offering a chance to discover new favourites or revisit old friends. You can even purchase a bottle to take home and enjoy later. Their knowledgeable sommelier is a delight! They provide spot-on recommendations based on your preferences, ensuring a perfect wine pairing for your evening. Adding to the ambiance, the bar is frequented by locals. This creates a genuine and welcoming atmosphere, allowing you to truly feel the pulse of Avignon.Their cheese platter is a masterpiece, bursting with flavour and perfectly complementing the wines. It truly saved our evening, transforming it into a memorable experience. If you're looking for a cozy and authentic wine bar with exceptional service and a fantastic selection, look no further than Vins-7! It's the perfect spot to unwind and indulge in the delights of the region.

We had a wonderful relaxed evening with excellent wine and really delicious food prepared with care and using products clearly sourced from high quality producers. The carpaccio was really fantastic - fresh and flavourful. The owner was friendly and very knowledgeable about local wines and picked us a perfect wine that fit our preferences for character but also price range which was much appreciated. A really lovely local wine bar - you must visit!

places.generalDescription: N¬∞15 - Les Confidences - Chambres d'h√¥tes offers a tranquil Provence-style retreat in a serene residential area near the town center. The six-room guesthouse features a lush garden with mature trees, a bamboo grove, and a refreshing swimming pool. Guests can also enjoy the bright and cozy rooms with luxurious amenities like tubs and showers. The hosts provide warm hospitality and excellent recommendations for local attractions and dining options.

sources.snippet: Num√©ro 15 - Les Confidences is a charming guest house located in the heart of Avignon, 500 metres from Le Palais des Papes. It offers 5 charming rooms and suites redecorated by Gilles Jauffret and a cosy garden with a swimming pool.
sources.shortName: Romantic weekends and stays in Provence

places.name: N¬∞15 - Les Confidences - Chambres d'h√¥tes

reviews.text:
The room in the hotel is very cozy, clean, and tastefully furnished ‚Äì everything is thoughtfully arranged to ensure nice stay. A comfortable bed, soft lighting, and large windows make it especially pleasant.

I would like to highlight the breakfast separately. A delicious, homemade breakfast fills your day with warmth and energy. Everything is fresh, flavorful, and prepared with care ‚Äì from fluffy bread to seasonal fruits and aromatic coffee.

A small pool and a beautiful garden add a special charm to the place. I recommend this hotel to anyone who values comfort, tranquility, and a warm atmosphere.

My husband and I couldn't say enough good things about this sweet little bed and breakfast.  We were on the first floor with direct access to the beautiful patio. It's very quiet with a lush garden and small pool.
The location is wonderfully located on a quiet street, with just a short walk to restaurants and shops.
Jean-Luc and Valerie were most helpful and provided a great breakfast to start the day. Should we ever have the fortune of visiting beautiful Avignon again, we will definitely choose to stay with these wonderful people.

This was amazing! From the spacious rooms with very comfortabe beds, very French continental  breakfast and lovely warm hosts.  Central to old town, super quiet just lovely. Would come back again.  Good for group stays. Pretty French garden with plunge pool.

places.generalDescription: Hotel d'Europe is an elegant lodging housed in a historic mansion dating back to 1580, making it one of the oldest hotels in France. Located in the heart of Avignon, this luxury hotel offers views of Palais des Papes and is within walking distance of Pont d'Avignon. The property features antique-filled interiors alongside modern amenities such as complimentary Wi-Fi, concierge services, and a garden terrace.

sources.snippet: One of the oldest hotels in France, Hotel d'Europe traces its roots back to the 16th century. Since then, it has been lovingly refurbished, but still retains a timelessness and enduring sense of regality. Travelers remark about the genuine hospitality and sophisticated decor.
sources.shortName: Avignon, France Travel Guide

sources.snippet: A grand old hotel tucked away in a serene square in the heart of Avignon. Rooms are furnished traditionally and elegantly, fit for a king of bygone days, but with all the modern touches expected in the 21st century. La Vieille Fontaine adds to the regal appeal.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Avignon, France (2025)

places.name: Hotel d'Europe

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary,. It's right off the TGV in Avignon we stopped as we were heading south, we stayed one night and it was very romantic, very beautiful. The town is a gem and the hotel is as quaint and beautiful as you can imagine..

Disappointing Experience Despite a Charming Setting

We stayed at Hotel Europe in Avignon for one night, from April 30th to May 1st. The hotel itself has undeniable charm-an elegant, old-style luxury with a lot of character. Our room was particularly spacious and included a cute little balcony. The location is also excellent: perfectly situated to explore Avignon on foot.

However, our overall experience was unfortunately marred by a serious lack of consideration for guests' comfort. We paid around ‚Ç¨460 for the night, expecting a restful and high-end stay. Instead, on the morning of May 1st- a public holiday-we were woken up at 9 a.m. (possibly even earlier) by what can only be described as construction-site noise: loud banging, metal being cut, and heavy machinery sounds. When I opened the window, I could see that the noise was coming from some sort of renovation or construction work within the hotel itself.

We eventually got up and decided to check out earlier than planned. During check-out, the receptionist politely asked how our stay had been, and I responded honestly, expressing that it was unacceptable to disturb guests with such intense noise at that hour, especially on a holiday morning. Her response was quite dismissive-she mentioned they were ‚Äúinstalling mirrors or something like that‚Äù-and proceeded to charge me an additional ‚Ç¨26.60 for the use of the parking without acknowledging the inconvenience we experienced.

Let me be clear: this complaint is not about the money. It's about manners and respect for the guest. When a customer points out that their sleep was disturbed by noise caused by the hotel itself, and particularly when that customer is staying at a so-called 5-star property and paying close to ‚Ç¨500 per night, the very least you would expect is a gesture of goodwill. Waiving the parking fee or offering a token of apology would have been appropriate and professional.

We chose this hotel hoping for a restful and luxurious experience. Instead, I left feeling disappointed and unrested. It's a pity because the hotel really does have potential. But service matters just as much as style-and this was not the service one should expect from a 5-star establishment.

At Hotel d'Europe, you quickly realize the hype is absolutely deserved. The restaurant delivers an upscale yet approachable dining experience, where refinement never overshadows warmth.

The atmosphere is elegant and historic, but never stiff - it feels like the perfect setting for a special meal that's still inviting and comfortable. The cooking is precise and thoughtful, with dishes that showcase both creativity and classic technique. Service matches the setting: attentive, professional, and genuinely welcoming.

In short, it's a place where everything comes together seamlessly - food, ambiance, and hospitality - making for a meal that feels truly memorable.

sources.shortName: The Project Gutenberg eBook of Romantic Cities of Provence, by Mona Caird

reviews.text:
We went to 5 diferent garages before someone gave us the address of this guy, . The reverse gear in our VW camper van, wouldn't work, He went inside just for check up, crunch ,push ,he turned the engine on, put to the gear on reverse and here our baby start moving back.... Me and my husband absolutely speachlles. Like an angel from the sky with his magical wand made it work... Not just a master mechanic, who is an expert , but also a kind, very helpful, man .
We strongly recommend the garage, if there is  no one around to fix your old car, you can be 100% sure that this is the man you need...
Thank you  so much for helping us out with the gearbox issue not just in one occasion.
God bless , keep well you and your family  üôè‚ù£Ô∏è

Subsequently, electrical problems were numerous and penalizing. But the Charettes restored everything, for a reasonable price, and my car runs like new!
I highly recommend Les Charettes.

sources.snippet: He ardently championed the cause of Rienzi, and of the Emperor Charles IV.; for the idea of keeping up the succession of the Holy Roman Empire appealed powerfully to his imagination, and when that monarch gave up his campaign before he had made good his imperial claims on Italy, Petrarch wrote bitterly reproaching him for abandoning so sacred a heritage.
sources.shortName: The Project Gutenberg eBook of Romantic Cities of Provence, by Mona Caird

reviews.text: great place to buy a hat. Lots of options of handmade hats and the owner is very kind and helpful. Highly recommended.

places.generalDescription: H√¥tel Le Magnan is a charming two-star venue located within the ancient walls of Avignon. The hotel offers contemporary rooms with en-suite bathrooms, catering to solo travelers, couples, and families. Guests can enjoy a hearty buffet breakfast in the sunny dining room or on the peaceful garden patio. With amenities such as free Wi-Fi, a restaurant, 24-hour front desk, air conditioning, and family rooms, H√¥tel Le Magnan ensures both comfort and convenience for its guests.

sources.snippet: Boasting an enviable setting within the ancient walls of Avignon, Le Magnan is a two-star hotel offering everything guests need for a comfortable stay. En-suite bathrooms come as standard in each of the contemporary rooms, with a diversity of choices for solo travellers, couples and families. A hearty buffet breakfast is served each morning in the sun-dappled dining room or can be enjoyed on the serene garden patio.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Stay in Avignon, France

places.name: H√¥tel Le Magnan

reviews.text: Brilliant location. Used this hotel as our first stopping point on our roadtrip and it was lovely. The receptionist was so helpful and informative; there is ample parking and the rooms were so spacious and airy. We had a lovely window in our room that was huge. I needed an iron and the lady at the desk had it all ready for me to collect and use. Housekeeping also so friendly. Location is perfect: walking distance from the town centre but far enough to have some peace.
Lovely little place with friendly staff and a very nice room. Hreat location. Also a lovely breakfast
Great little hotel. The location is convenient - close to the center but quiet. Staff was very friendly and the room was clean and spacious for a European hotel :) good strong AC and WiFi.

places.address: 63 Rue du Portail Magnanen, 84000 Avignon, France

sources.snippet: She married into the house of De Sades (or so runs the story) and she was a niece of the famous Fanette, who was President of the renowned Court of Love at the Ch√¢teau of Romanin in the Alpilles: those strange little limestone mountains that we saw to the south as we looked over the country from the Rocher du Dom.
sources.shortName: The Project Gutenberg eBook of Romantic Cities of Provence, by Mona Caird

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Ordered a buffet for a festive evening, everything was delicious and plentiful! Fresh, good, and tasty! I recommend it 100%. A lovely team and excellent advice.

places.generalDescription: Orange is a charming town located just 25 minutes from Avignon by train, making it easily accessible for visitors. The town offers a mix of ancient Roman ruins and modern attractions, such as the Roman theatre where concerts are held. The rail network from Avignon provides convenient access to Orange and other destinations in Provence and the south of France, making it an ideal base for exploring the region. Visitors have praised the customer service at local establishments in Orange.

sources.shortName: The Project Gutenberg eBook of Romantic Cities of Provence, by Mona Caird

places.name: Orange

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) A big thank you to Joelle, an exceptional advisor at Orange. Professional, attentive, and incredibly competent, she was able to meet all my expectations with a smile and remarkable efficiency. A real gem who makes all the difference in the store! The rest of the team is also very friendly, which makes the experience even more enjoyable.

places.address: CENTRE COMMERCIAL ESPACE SOLEIL, 533 Av. Louis Braille, 84130 Le Pontet, France

places.generalDescription: Avignon TGV is a modern and well-maintained high-speed train station in France, serving as a major arrival point for travelers from cities like Nice, Marseille, and Paris. The station offers clean facilities with informative screens for train positioning and arrivals. While the food options are somewhat limited and slightly expensive, the station provides frequent shuttle trains to the city center. Additionally, it features rental car services that offer a straightforward process for travelers.

sources.snippet: We rented a car from Avignon TGV station via Rentalcars which we found to be a very straightforward process. You‚Äôll need to get from Avignon city centre to the TGV station (by train or by taxi).
sources.shortName: 23 Captivating Things to Do in Avignon: Insider's Guide
A romantic weekend in Avignon

places.name: Avignon TGV

reviews.text: Futuristic modern station. The first class seating area for the TGV is very comfortable. Plus there's a piano to play!

This outside-of-town train station has been thought and built like an airport. The two-lane access road turns around the terminal, there is oncoming traffic. Cars and taxis can stop by and drop off their passengers at a short-time no-fee car park. There is also a dedicated area for long-term parking. This is all smooth and efficient.
Inside the station, the same airport-like impression continues on with high ceilings and glass walls that allow for plenty of light. Travellers have to go through a gated check-in procress manned efficiently by SNCF crew. After the gate, there is a lift for people who can't walk up the ramp to the non-heated waiting room where one can have a seat and charge their empty batteries.
Toilets are available on the ground floor. There is no ticketing office on the departure side of the station but there are ATM where travellers can purchage, withdraw their tickets, modify their journeys. Moreover, the SNCF crew is willing to help and assist.

Small but good enough to cover the people needs. Shop, couple of coffee shops. Clear signs - green boards for arrival trains and blue for departure. You don't need to come here  more than 10 - max. 15 min prior train departure time.
All major rental car companies have offices right outside so this is a good point to rent a car as well. The Pope palace is 15 min drive away from here.

sources.snippet: From this point its walls are strikingly picturesque, ramparts of the fourteenth century, built by Clement VI. and described by a modern author as a "remarkably beautiful specimen of medi√¶val masonry, with a battlemented wall for projecting machicolations on finely moulded corbels"‚Äîcorbels of four or five courses, which give an appearance almost Eastern to these splendid walls and gateways.
sources.shortName: The Project Gutenberg eBook of Romantic Cities of Provence, by Mona Caird

places.name: Cl√©ment VI Avignon library

reviews.text: It's a goodshop for Christian books

There are many nice things to give as gifts, and also a multitude of very interesting books (biographies, comics...) Really recommended. A pleasure to be able to buy in traditional stores, where a person serves you with dedication.

places.generalDescription: La Banasterie is a charming 16th-century B&B located in the heart of Avignon, just steps away from Palais des Papes. The rustic, country-style rooms exude elegance and some even feature balconies. Guests can enjoy the rooftop terrace with stunning views and complimentary Wi-Fi. This historic B&B offers 6 air-conditioned rooms, a flowered patio, and a library for guests to relax in.

sources.snippet: A beautiful 16th-century residence just a few steps from the romantic Pont Saint-B√©n√©zet and 50 metres from the historic Papal Palace. The rooms are simultaneously stylish, elegant and cosy. Enjoy the atmospheric stone walls and a private terrace or patio and even your own fountain!
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Avignon, France (2025)

sources.snippet: Experience the enchantment of history at La Banasterie, Avignon‚Äôs oldest B&B (founded in 1521). Nestled in the heart of the city, steps away from the Palais des Papes, it offers individually decorated rooms, a charming terrace, flowered patio, and a library.
sources.shortName: 23 Captivating Things to Do in Avignon: Insider's Guide

places.name: La Banasterie

reviews.text: Our stay at Banasterie in Avignon was great. We loved everything about the place,the neighborhood and of course the people. The owners are so kind and tell you everything you need to know about Avignon. Our room had everything we needed it was clean with lovely decoration . The breakfast was homemade served in a beautiful room. Totally recommend!
Wonderful place to spend a holiday.  The hosts are very welcoming.  They share a lot of information about Avignon.  The breakfasts are a satisfying start to the day.

Character, location and hosts!! We stayed for three days and had a great time in Avignon!! Our hosts, Veronique and Fabrice were superb!  When we arrived they spent time with us to review a map of the city and make recommendations of where to go and what to do. They made dinner reservations for us at delicious restaurants!  The room was clean and functional. This is a 500 year old building with tons of character. The rooms have air conditioning and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was excellent! There is no elevator  but Fabrice carried our bags to our room. We highly recommend this great place!
